page.title: 10Industry in Bredfield
page.content: There is a forge in Bredfield where originally a blacksmith worked mending farm machinery and shoeing horses. Nowadays the company makes ornamental metalwork such as gates, fire guards, coffee tables, foot scrapers and brackets for hanging baskets of flowers. Their gates have been sent to twenty one countries all over the world as far away as Australia. They have made all the gates for the Queen's estate at Sandringham, and made a foot scraper as a wedding present for the Prince and Princess of Wales. To celebrate the coronation of Queen Elisabeth the Second the Forge made an ornamental signpost round the pump which is in the middle of a fork in the road at one end of Bredfield. The Forge also makes ladders and does a great deal of metal repair work at the American Air Force bases.
